Several cruise missiles are flying to Kyiv. Unclear if these are Iskander-Ks or Kh-101s.
3 groups of 2 missiles, all flying to Kyiv. About 2.5 minutes away if they don‚Äôt change course significantly.
The first pair is approaching Brovary, Kyiv Oblast, flying to Kyiv. Course unchanged.
The first pair is approaching Brovary, Kyiv Oblast, flying to Kyiv. Course unchanged.
Past Brovary to northeastern Kyiv. Approaching the city.
No maps right now sorry, I‚Äôm reporting from my phone
Past Brovary to northeastern Kyiv. Approaching the city.
Over Kyiv, flying to Obolonskyi District, northern Kyiv.
Other missiles are following. Course unchanged through the northern suburbs.
All six missiles are over the city.
Missiles changed course to the southwest, flying to the southwestern suburbs past Obolonskyi District.
Multiple explosions in Kyiv. Missiles have disappeared.

Missiles had the characteristics of Iskander-Ks. Activity related to Iskander-ks was recorded earlier today and yesterday. 
The usage of Kh-101s from a Tu-95MS/160 strategic bomber operating on a frequency not known to be combat-related is not ruled out, but seems unlikely.
Security camera footage shows 13 consecutive Iskander-K cruise missile impacts in Kyiv. It seems the groups contained more missiles than previously thought.
Additional scenes from Kyiv. This is the largest single Iskander-K attack since the beginning of the war.
2 Iskanders on Chernihiv Oblast.
2 Iskanders on Chernihiv Oblast.
Flying to Kyiv Oblast.
Disappeared around a minute ago. Probably electronic warfare.

There is significant damage to civilian infrastructure in Kyiv, although its unclear if any missiles or drones directly impacted residential buildings. The main target of the attack remains unknown, but I will make a more in-depth report on this and other targeted regions later.

There is significant damage to civilian infrastructure in Kyiv, although its unclear if any missiles or drones directly impacted residential buildings. The main target of the attack remains unknown, but I will make a more in-depth report on this and other‚Ä¶
Ukrainian air defence also hardly operated. Very little Anti-air fire, and a couple of SAMs lightly operated. No missiles were intercepted.

Russian forces have captured the city of Chasiv Yar, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast. 
The battle lasted for 483 days, making it the third longest battle of the war, after Marinka (616 days), and Pervomaiske (545 days). 
Pre-war population: ~14,400.
Total land area: ~13.0km¬≤.
Flags have gone up across the city, including in areas that have been under Russian control for some time.

Russian forces have captured the city of Chasiv Yar, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.   The battle lasted for 483 days, making it the third longest battle of the war, after Marinka (616 days), and Pervomaiske (545 days).   Pre-war population: ~14‚Ä¶
To put it in perspective, this is how much the frontline in Donetsk Oblast has changed since the battle of Chasiv Yar began on April 4, 2024.

Here is a map showing the status of the 52 different settlements in Donetsk Oblast with city status.
18 (34.6%) were under full Russian control before 2022.
18 (34.6%) have been fully captured by Russia since 2022.
2 (3.8%) remain contested.
13 (25%) are under full Ukrainian control.
With the fall of Chasiv Yar, the total number of cities under Russian control in Donetsk Oblast has now doubled since the beginning of the war. 
Note: Horlivka and Donetsk City are included in the orange category as their outskirts were not fully under Russian control on February 24, 2022.

UK Is Too Concerned About Russia Building Aircraft Shelters (Photos)
Russia is building hardened aircraft shelters at air bases located closest to Ukraine, the United Kingdom Ministry of Defense revealed on July 29.
According to British intelligence, in response to Ukrainian drone attacks, Russia has launched a program to protect vulnerable aircraft at several air bases near the Russian-Ukrainian border. These air bases include Millerovo, Kursk Vostochny, and Gvardeyskoye.
The UK‚Äôs interest in what Russia is doing with its own air bases is not surprising considering that British intelligence are suspected of directly aiding Ukrainian drone attacks.
Read more: 
HERE

The Graphite Controversy: Inside Israel‚Äôs Global Spyware Empire 
In 2024, WhatsApp exposed a cyberattack targeting 90 journalists and activists using zero-click spyware from Israeli firm Paragon Solutions, co-founded by former Prime Minister Ehud Barak. 
The spyware, named Graphite, granted full access to victims‚Äô phones without any user interaction. While Paragon claims to work only with democratic governments, the identity behind the attack remains unknown. 
The breach has sparked concerns about messaging app vulnerabilities and calls for stronger cyber defenses and scrutiny of past political assassinations potentially linked to digital surveillance.
Read more: 
HERE

Russian Troops Push into Kupyansk as Northern Encirclement Tightens
Following intense fighting on the northern frontlines, Russian forces have reached the northern outskirts of Kupyansk, marking a significant breakthrough in the Kharkiv region. 
Preliminary field reports confirmed Russian units have established positions along Michurina Street after breaching Ukrainian defenses. 
Urban combat now rages as Ukrainian troops desperately attempt to repel the advance, with reports indicating some Ukrainian counterattacks have faltered disastrously, including incidents of Ukrainian soldiers reportedly detonating on their own mines near the Oskol River due to disorientation and poor coordination.
Read more: 
HERE

Iranian Intelligence Shares Footage Of Anti-Mossad Operations During War With Israel 
The Iranian Ministry of Intelligence released on July 28 video footage documenting some of the operations it conducted against the Mossad spy agency during the 12-day war with Israel last month.
Israel started the war on June 13, stating that its goal was to cripple Iran‚Äôs nuclear program. The war ended when a ceasefire was suddenly announced on June 24, just two days after the United States joined the war by attacking three key nuclear sites in Iran.
Some 700 people suspected of working for Mossad were arrested by Iranian security forces during the war. At least few have already been convicted and executed.
Read more: 
HERE

Russian Tornado-S Target Ukrainian Drone Post With Precision-Guided Rockets (Video)
The Russian military‚Äôs Sever [North] Group of Forces struck several targets of Kiev forces in the Kharkiv direction with Tornado-S multiple rocket launchers, the Ministry of Defense announced on July 29.
In a brief statement, the ministry said that the targets included combat vehicles, an ammunition depot, a drone command post, and a gathering of troops.
Read more: 
HERE

Israel Assesses Hezbollah Took Heavy Losses, Could Agree To Disarm 
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) assesses that its attacks against Hezbollah since a November ceasefire could potentially force the group to disarm, The Times of Israel reported on July 29, citing military officials.
The ceasefire between Israel and Lebanon was brokered by the United States. The IDF didn‚Äôt only continue to target Hezbollah amid the ceasefire, but also kept troops at five strategic posts in southern Lebanon, the heartland of the group, in defiance of the agreement.
Since the start of the ceasefire on November 27, the IDF said that it has carried out over 500 strikes against Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, killing at least 230 operatives and destroying over 90 rocket launchers and thousands of rockets, 20 command centers, 40 weapon depots, and five arms production sites, alongside other infrastructure.
